Title: Object: Départ des Israélites d'Egypte (Departure of the Israelites from Egypt)
Description: A classical city with imposing buildings, looking diagonally to right down a broad street lined with columns and pedestals, crowded with people leaving the city in attitudes of distress, including some in the left foreground who play harps; after Roberts. Mezzotint with etching
Producer name: Print made by: James G S Lucas
Curator's comments: For a related print with slightly different format, see 2010,7081.7173
Funder name: With contribution from: National Heritage Memorial Fund
With contribution from: British Museum Friends
With contribution from: Friends of Prints and Drawings
With contribution from: Mrs Charles Wrightsman
With contribution from: Michael Marks Charitable Trust
Acquisition notes: Acquired with the assistance of the National Heritage Memorial Fund, the Friends of the British Museum, the Art Fund, Mrs Charles Wrightsman, the Michael Marks Charitable Trust, and numerous individual donors.
